sentence.Network_en: They have been fighting a rearguard action for two years to stop their house being demolished.
sentence.Network_cn: 两年来，为了不让拆除他们的房子，他们一直在进行最后的努力。

sentence.Network_en: Mr Urban looks increasingly like someone fighting a rearguard action to keep their job.
sentence.Network_cn: 厄本先生越来越像为了保住工作作最后一搏的那些人。

sentence.Network_en: The government is fighting a rearguard action against the mass of public opinion.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府冒天下之大不韪负隅顽抗.

list.abs: acknowledges the former AC Milan striker will be a loss for the hosts , but feels they have other options that can cause Liverpool's rearguard problems .斯科特尔认为前锋AC米兰的前锋的缺阵对主队是一种损失，但是他认为还拥有其他的选择扰乱利物浦后防。

the Reds vice-captain admits he has struggled to hit peak form so far this season but insists it won't be long before both he , and the Liverpool rearguard , are back amongst the shut-outs .利物浦副队承认他目前为止他的状态一直摇摆不定，但是他强调这个糟糕局面不会在持续多久了，他和利物浦后卫正在回到严加死守的防守布阵。

后天养成的嗜好/acquired taste后卫战斗/rearguard action后支重桥/tag axle

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the rear part of an army): from Old French rereguarde

entry.tran: （尤指战场上军队撤退时的）后卫部队
entry.def: In a battle, the rearguard is a group of soldiers who protect the back part of an army, especially when the army is leaving the battle.
If someone is fighting a rearguard action or mounting a rearguard action, they are trying very hard to prevent something from happening, even though it is probably too late for them to succeed.

example.ex: Mr Urban looks increasingly like someone fighting a rearguard action to keep their job.
example.tran: 厄本先生越来越像为了保住工作作最后一搏的那些人。

means.word_mean: 1. a detachment assigned to protect the rear of a (retreating) military body
